properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 9:55PM PST until January 11 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW SHIFTING INTO IDAHO AND FAR NORTHEASTERN
WASHINGTON...

.Snow is tapering off in the Spokane Area and on the Palouse but
remains moderate to heavy in areas of the Idaho Panhandle and far
northeastern reaches of Washington.  Light to moderate snow
showers also continue along the Cascade Crest.  Another
disturbance will move into the region overnight with light snow
showers returning to most locations across Eastern Washington and
North Idaho.  Additional accumulations of 1 to 3 inches will be
possible with locally higher amounts with this second wave into
Saturday..

* WHAT...Heavy snow for The Cascade Crest including Highway 2
between Coles Corner and Stevens Pass. Additional snow
accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with amounts near one to two
feet closer to the crest. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Mazama, Stehekin, Plain, and Holden Village.

* WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas
of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SATURDAY FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
